title: Synvra: Compliance-by-Design LIMS
description: Defining product vision and architecture for a compliance-by-design LIMS and validation automation platform for regulated laboratories (21 CFR Part 11, ALCOA+, ISO 17025).
fullDescription: A next-generation Laboratory Information Management System built with regulatory compliance as a first-class architectural concern. Designed for ISO 17025 / GLP/GMP / FDA 21 CFR Part 11 labs, featuring audit-ready records, electronic signatures, and full traceability by default.
problem: Existing LIMS solutions treat compliance as an afterthought, leading to expensive retrofitting, audit failures, and operational friction for regulated laboratories.
constraints: Must satisfy 21 CFR Part 11 electronic records requirements, ALCOA+ data integrity principles, and ISO/IEC 17025:2017 technical requirements. Zero tolerance for data integrity gaps.
approach: Architecting with compliance patterns embedded at the data layer: immutable audit logs, e-signatures, version control, and traceability baked into the core data model rather than bolted on.
tradeoffs: Prioritizing regulatory rigor over feature velocity. Choosing PostgreSQL and event-sourcing patterns for guaranteed audit trails.
execution: Currently in development. Defining roadmap, core workflows, and data model around ALCOA+ and ISO/IEC 17025:2017 requirements.
outcomes: In active development. Positioning for MENAP laboratory market as 'compliance-by-design LIMS + validation acceleration' rather than generic LIMS vendor.
